p.style: text-align: center;

div.p: During the extended closure through the remainder of the school year, this website has been created to help our families with instructional resources, FAQs, Ohio Department of Education updates, and more.

p.style: text-align: center;

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

p.style: text-align: center;

h3.div: At this time of uncertainty, when collaboration is key, please know that our regular District communications from Three Rivers Local School District will not change. This additional TRLSD site was created to provide direct building-level supports to our students, families, and staff during the extended closure of buildings. We will continue to update this site as the State and Federal government push information and guidance out to our District, so please check back frequently.

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

font-family: Roboto;

em.strong: > How Will Students Retrieve Items Left in Building?

div.p: With the Governor closing the buildings for the remainder of the school year, how will students retrieve necessary items left in the building?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 71px; margin-right: 71px; padding-left: 0; text-align: center; text-indent: 0;

div.p: (a detailed plan will be shared here as soon as information is finalized)

p.style: margin-left: 80px; padding-left: 0; text-indent: 0;

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

font-family: Roboto;

div.p: See information below for a fun, new way to let us know what you are reading at home.

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 71px; margin-right: 71px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: This unprecedented time in history has given us a unique opportunity to READ!! We can select a book and escape into its pages to another place and time.

p.style: margin-left: 71px; margin-right: 71px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: Historians are recording how we are handling COVID-19. So, let's record our own history by posting every title Three Rivers students read on a wall in the Carl Hunsicker Media Center!

p.style: margin-left: 71px; margin-right: 71px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: If one student reads a title, the title will be posted on the wall. If several students read the same book, that title will be posted in a larger font size.

p.style: margin-left: 71px; margin-right: 71px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Readers will be given a book choice by looking at the titles on the wall that you have recommended.

p.style: margin-left: 71px; margin-right: 71px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Let's read and show future generations of Three Rivers students

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

h3.style: margin-left: 71px; margin-right: 71px; padding-left: 0; text-align: center; text-indent: 0;

span.style: top: -11px
font-family: Roboto; font-size: 22px; font-style: normal; font-weight: 300; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

div.span: You may read a print book, an e-book, an audio book, a book read to you, a book you read to another person! Just record what you have read in the survey. Select books from your personal library, the TRLSD media center, book fair, Public Library of Cincinnati and Hamilton County, Junior Library Guild, Bookflix, or any book database on our website....

p.style: margin-left: 71px; margin-right: 71px; padding-left: 0; text-align: center; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: JUST READ!

p.style: margin-left: 71px; margin-right: 71px; padding-left: 0; text-align: center; text-indent: 0;

span.style: text-decoration: underline;
span.a: CLICK HERE TO ACCESS THE SITE NOW AND SHARE WHAT YOU ARE READING!

p.style: margin-left: 80px; padding-left: 0; text-indent: 0;

div.p: 4th Quarter Grading and High School Credits

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: During the COVID-19 public health crisis, we are committed to being both fair and equitable in our grading practices. We truly understand the hardships that many of our students and families face at this difficult time but also understand that it is important that instruction and learning continue. Please see below for our grading scale for remote learning, during our “physical school closure” for the fourth quarter.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: - Students make a good faith effort to complete the work and engage in the learning activities.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: A passing grade will be indicated as an “A” in the fourth quarter.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: - Students do not make an effort to complete work or engage in the learning activities.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: - Students complete the work provided by teachers for completion during the “physical closure of school.” A “P,” passing grade will be weighted at the highest level possible for the course the student is taking (eg. 4.0 or above).

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: - Students do not show evidence for completion of work during the “physical closure.” This student will be . . .

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Assigned an incomplete for the course. This work must be made up within a designated time period (TBA) or will be identified as a failing grade.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: We will make every reasonable effort to ensure that our students complete this work and receive a passing grade for the fourth quarter.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Assigned to participate in Jacket Time for the first quarter 2020-21 school year.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;
margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

em.strong: Note: There will be no final exams for the 2019-2020 school year for those students participating in High School credit classes. The overall grade calculation will be modified.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: During our “physical school closure” we intend to provide necessary learning activities for our students that allow them to obtain full credit for the courses in which they are enrolled. We understand that this is a difficult time for our students and families. Our intent is to be equitable in our grading practices for all students and provide everyone with the opportunity to gain full course credit, which will not have a negative impact on their GPA. Taylor High School’s “grading plan” for the fourth quarter can be seen below.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: - Students complete the work provided by teachers for completion during the “physical closure of school.” A “P,” passing grade will be weighted at the highest level possible for the course the student is taking (eg. 4.0 or above).

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: - Students do not show evidence for completion of work during the “physical closure.” This student will be . . .

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Assigned an incomplete for the course. This work must be made up within a designated time period (TBA) or will be identified as a failing grade.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: We will make every reasonable effort to ensure that our students complete this work and receive a passing grade for the fourth quarter.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: center; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

em.strong: Note: There will be no final exams for the 2019-2020 school year. The overall grade calculation will be modified.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: center; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

em.strong: Students taking AP or CCP courses may have additional requirements that will be communicated directly from your child’s teachers.

p.style: margin-left: 0; padding-left: 0; text-indent: 0;

div.p: What is the District's Plan for Instruction?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.p: In response to the extended closure, each building has established a remote learning plan, with a detailed schedule. Teachers will use this schedule to be in consistent communication with students and families in regards to assignments, deadlines, grading guidelines, and more. If you have any further questions in regards to remote learning, please reach out to homeroom teachers.

p.em: *Please know that this plan may be adjusted based upon Federal and State guidance, or the needs of our students/community.

div.p: District staff members have made a list of grade-band resources and practice activities that families can access here:

p.style: text-align: center;

span.style: text-decoration: underline;
font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: text-align: center;

span.style: text-decoration: underline;
font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.style: text-align: center;

span.style: text-decoration: underline;

p.style: text-align: center;

div.p: Will my child(ren) be impacted by State Testing?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: On March 25, the General Assembly passed House Bill (HB) 197 in response to the COVID-19 public health crisis. The following are HB 197’s education-related changes of interest to our community. We will continue to provide more clarity around these areas once we receive further information from ODE.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

li.p: Ohio has removed the requirement to conduct state testing for the 2019-2020 school year. There will be no state testing for 2019-2020, regardless of the date we return to school.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

li.p: Removes the Ohio School Report Cards for the upcoming school year

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

li.p: Freezes the EdChoice eligibility on the 2019-2020 list. This means that Taylor High School will not be an EdChoice School. The legislature will continue to work on long-term solutions for school funding.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Allows for all seniors to graduate if determined that they have successfully completed their high school curriculum

div.p: Are there additional educational resources I can access above and beyond what my child's teacher has assigned?

div.p: Will we have to make up school days for this school year?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.p: House Bill 197 also gave initial guidance around calamity and "make up" days. The bill permits schools to make up time through distance learning, for any number of days or hours necessary, to meet minimum instructional hour requirements.
We will continue with our current plan until we receive additional guidance from the Ohio Department of Education.

div.p: In response to the Governor's mandated school closure to slow the spread of COVID-19, Three Rivers has a group of local organizations and volunteers that are working diligently to continue nutrition services for our students who qualify for free and reduced lunch.

p.span: 2-day lunch and breakfast packs will be provided to students on Free and Reduced Lunch.

p.span: During distribution stops, the School Nurse’s Office and Miami Township Fire Department will be providing information and educational resources concerning COVID-19. Additionally, we value the importance of reading, and will be offering free books to children of all ages and adults.

p.span: How will special education services be provided to my child during the school closure?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.p: Your child’s intervention specialist, related service provider, and teacher(s) will be collaborating virtually during the closure period. They will use this time to create instructional materials and resources that meet your child’s individual needs, based on his or her IEP or 504 plan. Your child’s school-based IEP team is dedicated to making a good-faith effort to ensure delivery of special education and related services while school is closed. During the week of March 23 all Intervention Specialists and Related Service Therapists began reaching out to make contact with all families on their caseload. These conversations detailed how services and support can be provided during this closure. If you have not been contacted, please reach out to Megan Rivet, mrivet@trlsd.org, Director of Student Services, or your building principal.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: If I have an upcoming meeting to discuss Special Education/Section 504 eligibility, or my child's IEP or 504 is due before the end of the school year, will this meeting still occur?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 8px; margin-right: 48px; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: Team members have planned to hold phone conferences, Google Hangouts/Meet (video calls), or Zoom (video) in situations where Evaluation Team Reports (ETR), Individualized Education Plans (IEP), or 504 Plans are due. Your child’s case manager will reach out to you to plan for this meeting or to reschedule meetings that are not immediately due.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: Best Point Behavioral Health (by The Children’s Home) is still open and providing services. When schools were cancelled and restrictions regarding face to face interactions were put into place, the agency prioritized the implementation of Telehealth so they would be able to continue service delivery. They have a Telehealth service they are able to use for video conferencing with clients and families called Updox. They are able to provide counseling, school-based day treatment services, care coordination, and medication management services through this platform. The Three Rivers team is actively reaching out to families to provide ongoing services via telehealth – through phone or video conferencing. Provider expectations are that they are delivering the services as planned, via telehealth, as long as COVID-19 restrictions are in place.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: What does my child do if we do not have access to WiFi or devices?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: Charter Communications is offering free Spectrum broadband and Wi-Fi access to families with students in K-12 who do not already have a Spectrum broadband subscription. To access this parents should call (844) 488-8395.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: For more information:

font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: underline; vertical-align: baseline;

div.p: How will technology be utilized during this time? Will video conferencing be utilized?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: All teachers have digital platform hubs already established. Grades K-2 utilize Symbaloo and Grades 3-12 utilize Google Classroom.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: Teachers will be using a variety of methods to reach all students through email, phone calls, and digital resources. Video-conferencing will also be utilized through Google Hangouts/Meet and Zoom. These links will be made available through classroom teachers.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: Click on your child's school tab at the top of this website for more technology information and resources.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

div.p: What are some virtual meeting reminders?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

li.p: ALL video conference links will be shared by classroom teachers through email, Google Classrooms, or other communications.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: NO ONE should record any live (synchronous) meetings with students.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

li.p: NO ONE should take pictures of their screen where student pictures and names are present.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Remember, the background captured on video will be visible to all participants in the meeting. Please make sure that your child's background is clear of anything that you don't want visible to the entire class!

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: center; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
span.strong: Google Meet/Hangout/Zoom Etiquette Guide for Students

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

li.p: When you enter the Meet/Hangout, mute yourself (If you are not already muted) to avoid background noise. Turn mute off when you are ready to speak.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: When you have a question, type in the textbox and wait for your teacher to call on you.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: When you have something to contribute to what is being said, but it is not your turn, use the chat feature in the right-hand corner.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

li.p: Wait for the teacher to call on you then unmute yourself.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Only one student should contribute/talk at a time.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Look into the camera when you are talking.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

span.style: font-family: Roboto; font-size: 18px; font-style: normal; font-weight: normal; text-decoration: normal; vertical-align: baseline;

p.span: Stay attentive. Pay attention to your teacher or other students who are speaking.

p.style: margin-left: 0; margin-right: 0; padding-left: 0; text-align: left; text-indent: 0;

li.p: Most importantly, have fun with this. We are lucky to live in a time where technology unites us when we can't be together!

p.style: margin-right: 0; text-align: left;

div.p: A.B.C. = Always Be Courteous

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: What is the protocol for cleaning at TRLSD?

div.jsaction: click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

click:cOuCgd; mousedown:UX7yZ; mouseup:lbsD7e; mouseenter:tfO1Yc; mouseleave:JywGue;touchstart:p6p2H; touchmove:FwuNnf; touchend:yfqBxc(preventMouseEvents=true|preventDefault=true); touchcancel:JMtRjd;focus:AHmuwe; blur:O22p3e; contextmenu:mg9Pef;

div.p: At this time, no students are permitted to be on campus for any reason. Although it is discouraged for any non-essential staff to enter the building, there is a sign-up for priority visits. Please know that we are checking everyone's temperature before allowing them to work on-site (custodial staff and volunteers for food packaging) or for teachers to quickly access the building to retrieve essential items.

TDG crew is currently going through the Campus checking all classrooms and common areas. The crew is working on a rotating schedule to dust, sweep floors, check for any trash, and disinfect high-touch areas. They also cleaned and disinfected the bus garage.
Additionally, custodial staff is coming in on Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays to disinfect and clean up after volunteers, when they are finished packing food for the mobile resource distribution.
All crew members are practicing social distancing in their cleaning efforts to remain healthy. If you have any questions or concerns about this process, please email Tim Wagner at twagner@trlsd.org.

div.p: We are dedicated to keeping consistent and relevant communication ongoing with our families during this time. Our normal newsletters will continue to be distributed. This site is a way to provide direct, building-level supports to our students, families and staff in the midst of the COVID-19 school closure. If any of our families have questions that we are not addressing, please do not hesitate to reach out to us.
You can submit a question using the form linked here.
